title: Japanese Font on
content:
Hey! Anyone know what font is used on [http://www.avast.co.jp/index](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/www.avast.co.jp/index "http://www.avast.co.jp/index")? Or any other versatile muti-weighted japanese fonts to use for web and app design? Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202013-05-23%20at%203_6590.01.51%20PM.png)
author: mariyac

comments.content: according to my handy-dandy whatfontis web tool, it's various styles of [Open Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/opensans.com/)

It’s [Hiragino Kaku Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/www.screen.co.jp/ga_product/sento/sample/hirg.html), a Japanese font shipped with Mac OS X.  
Check these out, if you are looking for other Japanese fonts:  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/typeproject](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/www.fonts.com/font/typeproject "http://www.fonts.com/font/typeproject") (Fonts.com also offers webfont versions of their fonts.)  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/jiyu-kobo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/www.fonts.com/font/jiyu-kobo "http://www.fonts.com/font/jiyu-kobo")  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/iwata](http://web.archive.org/web/20140713170319/http:/www.fonts.com/font/iwata "http://www.fonts.com/font/iwata")
